text: Why has no one made a  symphonic metal arrangement of this song?
author: Trapster2

text: I'd love to see a remake of this game. All it needs are a couple gameplay tweaks, and it'd be perfect. People complain about the running mechanic, but it wasn't that bad. I had a lot of time on my hands when I played this game, that might be why I love it so much. I worked with the games mechanics instead of complaining about them and got through the game smoothly several times. I kinda want to replay it again.
author: shadows531

text: A lot of the problems with the game stem from how all the gameplay mechanics clash with each other.  Other games (Final Fantasy: 4 Heroes of Light and Oreshika: Tainted Bloodlines come to mind) use various portions of the mechanics and tweak them a bit, and come out better for it.  It essentially has Alone in the Dark's problem; someone needed to be there to tell the people making the game to stop making more innovations.

author: C_Clop

text: Didn't like this game at all for one reason. Not being able to choose what to attack! In boss battles the AI was smart enough to take out the smaller guys first, but in regular battles it could all go to hell even though I could easily take them out. In the end played it through autoing the regular battles so I could get the blue chests

text:
Wow, I was gonna post a similar comment, but now I wonder...

text: The only game where loosing health while running makes sense is Half Minute Hero
author: SuperFaex

text:
@SupraDarky 
I completely agree. While I had fun at first, the whole "choose between exp and items that will never get you enough money" frustrated me and I ended up using my AR to get infinite money, cause it would take forever otherwise. Finally, towards the end the battle system got very repetitive and the difficulty ramped up too quickly.
author: Chris Paulus

text: It's worrisome that when people think of one of the best RPG series of the last 15 years or so, the first thing they think of is My Little Pony.

author: Skylar

text: I didn't really like this game. I was pretty desperate for an﻿ RPG on the DS at the time which is why I played it. It's not even in the same league as Silver Star and Eternal Blue. The only thing it had going for it was the music and the pleasant graphics. The battle system was broken (why choose between getting experience or items?), and losing health when running was ridiculous.
author: SupraDarky
